qas.question: What ruined Richard's plans to reach Acre?
What year did the storm hit Richard's fleet?
Who left Messina in the 11th century?
What year did Richards fleet avoid a storm?
Who ruled Cyprus in the 11th century?

context: In April <a2_0><a2_1><a2_2>1191<a2_2/><a2_1/><a2_0/> <b4_0>Richard the Lion-hearted<b4_0/> left Messina with a large fleet in order to reach Acre. But <a0_0><a0_1><a0_2>a storm<a0_2/><a0_1/><a0_0/> dispersed the fleet. After some searching, it was discovered that the boat carrying his sister and his fiancée <a1_0><a1_1><a1_2>Berengaria<a1_2/><a1_1/><a1_0/> was anchored on the south coast of Cyprus, together with the wrecks of several other ships, including the treasure ship. Survivors of the wrecks had been taken prisoner by the island's despot <a3_0><a3_2><b6_0>Isaac Komnenos<b6_0/><a3_2/><a3_0/>. On 1 May <b5_0>1191<b5_0/>, Richard's fleet arrived in the port of Limassol on Cyprus. He ordered <a3_1>Isaac<a3_1/> to release the prisoners and the treasure. Isaac refused, so Richard landed his troops and took Limassol.
